description: English language prompts for voice model training. Organized by phoneme categories to ensure comprehensive coverage.

pangrams.description: Sentences containing all letters of the alphabet
prompts: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
Pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs.
How vexingly quick daft zebras jump!
The five boxing wizards jump quickly.
Jackdaws love my big sphinx of quartz.
Mr Jock, TV quiz PhD, bags few lynx.
Sphinx of black quartz, judge my vow.
Two driven jocks help fax my big quiz.
Watch Jeopardy, Alex Trebek's fun TV quiz game.
By Jove, my quick study of lexicography won a prize.

plosives.description: Sentences emphasizing plosive consonants (p, b, t, d, k, g)
prompts: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers.
Big bad bears bounce beautiful balls.
Tiny Tim took two teddy bears to town.
Danny decided to dig ditches down deep.
Kicking cans keeps kids quite calm.
Good grief, Gary's gone and gotten a gecko.
Pat put the purple pumpkin in the pot.
Bob bought a batch of blue biscuits.
Ted told Tom to tidy the table.
Ducks dive deep down during December.
Katie kept kicking the kitchen kettle.
Greg grabbed the green grapes greedily.
The picky parrot pecked the pretty peaches.
Barbara baked brownies by the bakery.
Tim tried to tie twenty twisted ties.
Did Debbie decide to dance at the disco?
Karl called his cousin from Kentucky.
Go get the golden goose from the garden.

fricatives.description: Sentences emphasizing fricative consonants (f, v, θ, ð, s, z, ʃ, ʒ, h)
prompts: She sells seashells by the seashore.
The thistle sifter sifted thistles through.
Fresh French fried fish.
Vincent vowed vengeance very viciously.
Zany zebras zigzagged through the zoo.
His shirt has surely shrunk somewhat.
The unusual treasure measured pleasure.
Harry's house has huge hollow hallways.
Friendly Frank flips fine flapjacks fast.
Very vivid visions of Venice vanished.
Think thoroughly through those theories.
Father gathered feathers together there.
Six Swiss ships swished swiftly southward.
Zara's zesty zucchini amazed the zealots.
She should shush the shy sheriff.
The azure azure leisure seizure.
Happy Henry heard Helen humming.
Thoughtful Thelma thanked them thoroughly.
This, that, and the other thing.
Sheep should sleep in a shed.
The vision of the collision was a delusion.
The cheerful child chose chocolate chip cookies.
The judge enjoyed the gentle giant's joke.
Chester cheetah chews cheap cheese chips.
Jane juggled jars of jam and jelly.
Church choirs chant charming chanties.
George the giant giraffe joined the gym.
Chunky Charlie changed channels cheerfully.
The jovial judge judged justly.
Which witch watched which watch?
Jim just jumped on the jungle gym.
Catch the chubby chicken in the kitchen.
The jolly jester joked with the jealous janitor.

nasals.description: Sentences emphasizing nasal consonants (m, n, ŋ)
prompts: The king was singing along strongly.
Mommy made many muffins this morning.
Nine nice night nurses nursing nicely.
Morning mist made mountains mysterious.
Nancy needed nine new notebooks.
Long songs bring strong feelings among us.
Munching mushrooms makes me merry.
Nothing's remaining after the ringing.
My mind moved many memories.
Running among the ringing bells.
The young king sang a song at sunrise.
Men named Norman never name their sons Norman.

liquids_glides.description: Sentences emphasizing liquids (l, r) and glides (w, j)
prompts: Red lorry, yellow lorry, red lorry, yellow lorry.
William walked while whistling wistfully.
Young Yolanda yelled at yesterday's yams.
Really leery Larry rarely relies on rulers.
Willy's real rear wheel really rattles.
Yes, young Yale students yawn yearly.
Literally literary literature lovers.
We were worried when Wayne went west.
Your yellow yo-yo yielded yearly yields.
Larry's loyal llama lacks a leash.
Wild winds whipped through the willows.
Yelling yields yearning young yachtsmen.
The loyal royal lawyer rarely relaxed.
Wanda wondered where William was wandering.
Each eagle easily eats eager eels.
Six thick thistle sticks.
Red leather, yellow leather.
The cat sat on the mat with a bat.
Father and Arthur bathed in the bathroom.
Hot coffee costs lots of dollars.
Paul saw four tall horses walking north.
Good books look good on wooden hooks.
Sue's blue shoes are too loose.
The sun shone but none wanted to run.
A banana and a comma are common in drama.
Her bird chirped first in the early world.
Bit by bit, Jim built his little ship.
The head chef said the bread was ready.
Bad lads had glad dads.
A large car parked far from the bar.
The dog got lost in the fog.
My bike tire is quite nice and white.
How now brown cow?
Roy enjoys his toys with joy.
The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain.
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream.
Go slow over the road in the snow.
Near here, we fear the deer appear.
Their fair hair blew in the air.
The poor tourist took a tour.
Great apes make great escapes.
The shy guy flies high in the sky.
The noisy boys destroyed their toys.
The loud crowd shouted out loud.
The old soul strolled along the road.
We're nearly here, dear, never fear.
Where there's air, they're aware and care.
The cure for boredom is to endure more.

connected_speech.description: Natural sentences for prosody and connected speech practice
prompts: I'd like to order a large coffee with milk, please.
Could you tell me where the nearest bus stop is?
It's absolutely beautiful weather today, isn't it?
I'm not entirely sure what you mean by that.
Would you mind explaining that again more slowly?
I haven't seen you in ages! How have you been?
The presentation went really well, all things considered.
I'll need to think about that before making a decision.
That's exactly what I was trying to say earlier.
Do you have any plans for the upcoming weekend?
I completely forgot to mention something important.
We should probably get going if we want to be on time.
I didn't expect the movie to be quite so emotional.
The restaurant around the corner serves excellent pasta.
I've been meaning to ask you about your new project.
It might rain later, so don't forget your umbrella.
The traffic was absolutely terrible this morning.
I'd recommend the chocolate cake; it's delicious.
Have you ever considered traveling to New Zealand?
The meeting has been rescheduled to next Thursday.

emotions.description: Sentences designed to elicit emotional expression
prompts: I can't believe you actually did that! That's amazing!
I'm so sorry to hear about what happened.
This is the happiest day of my entire life!
I'm really worried about the situation.
What a pleasant surprise to see you here!
I'm absolutely furious about this decision.
That's the funniest thing I've heard all week!
I'm feeling a bit under the weather today.
Congratulations! You've earned this success!
I'm deeply grateful for all your help.
How incredibly disappointing this turned out to be.
I'm so excited I can barely contain myself!
What time does the store open tomorrow?
Have you finished your homework yet?
Where did you put my car keys?
Why didn't anyone tell me about this earlier?
How long have you been waiting here?
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Do you think it's going to rain today?
Which one of these would you prefer?
When are you planning to come back?
Would you like some more coffee?
Who's responsible for this mess?
Are you absolutely certain about that?

numbers_dates.description: Sentences with numbers and dates for clarity
prompts: The meeting is scheduled for March 15th, 2024.
My phone number is five five five, one two three four.
The total comes to forty-seven dollars and ninety-nine cents.
She was born on the twenty-third of June, nineteen eighty-five.
The flight departs at six forty-five in the morning.
We need exactly three hundred and twenty-seven units.
The address is fourteen twenty-one Oak Street.
The deadline is December thirty-first at midnight.
The recipe calls for two and a half cups of flour.
My appointment is at three fifteen this afternoon.
The algorithm processes data in real-time.
Please configure the network settings appropriately.
The pharmaceutical compound showed promising results.
The infrastructure requires significant investment.
The methodology was thoroughly peer-reviewed.
The electromagnetic spectrum includes visible light.
The constitutional amendment was ratified unanimously.
The biodegradable materials decompose naturally.
The cardiovascular system pumps blood efficiently.
The telecommunications industry continues to evolve.
